definitions.definition: an adult male human

examples.text: a good-looking young man
the relationships between men and women
the men's team/game/race/doubles/singles/event
The board of directors is dominated by middle-aged white men.
He was one of the great men of history.
Four armed men burst into the room.
An elderly Indian man sat down beside me and recounted his story.
He is an average working man trying to make ends meet.
The men's team won their third gold medal last year.
The picture shows a man in his thirties.
the man she sits next to at work
I gave some money to a homeless man in the park.
Is he the funniest man on earth?
He walked out of court a free man.
He was a lucky man to have found such a partner.
He was a self-made man who raised himself from poverty to success.
Mr Locke is a man of means who owns a vast business empire.
Police have arrested two men and a woman.
I was helped by two burly men with tattoos.
Over 150 men, women and children were killed.
Several people made speeches in honour of the great man.
Vincente is a wanted man back in his own country.
What a horrible man!
men in grey suits
a little old man
a middle-aged, balding man
Only the dead man's young son knows what happened.

definitions.definition: humans as a group, both male and female

examples.text: the damage caused by man to the environment
**The common man** *(= ordinary people)* is losing faith in democratic institutions.
the most poisonous substance known to man
It's a powerful indictment of the horrors of war and man's inhumanity to man.
In man the brain is highly developed.
The working man wants more and better jobs.

definitions.definition: a person, either male or female

examples.text: All men must die.
How could a human torture his fellow man?
While no man is an island, we do function independently for the most part.

definitions.definition: humans from a particular period of history

examples.text: early/modern/Prehistoric man

definitions.definition: a man who comes from the place mentioned or whose job or interest is connected with the thing mentioned

examples.text: a Frenchman
a sportsman
a businessman
a medical man

definitions.definition: a man who likes or who does the thing mentioned

examples.text: a betting/fighting man
I do drink tea at night but I'm a coffee man during the day.
I've never been a gambling man.

definitions.definition: a man who works for or supports a particular organization, comes from a particular town, etc.

examples.text: the BBC’s man in Moscow *(= the man who reports on news from Moscow)*
a loyal Republican Party man

definitions.definition: a soldier or a male worker who obeys the instructions of a person of higher rank

examples.text: The officer refused to let his men take part in the operation.
The conditions in which the men were working were terrible.

definitions.definition: a man who comes to your house to do a job

examples.text: the gas man
The man's coming to repair the TV today.

definitions.definition: used for addressing a male person

examples.text: Nice shirt, man!
Hey man. Back off!

definitions.definition: used for addressing a male person in an angry or impatient way

examples.text: Don't just stand there, man—get a doctor!

definitions.definition: a person's husband, boyfriend or male partner

examples.text: What's her new man like?
I now pronounce you man and wife *(= you are now officially married)*.

definitions.definition: a person who is strong and brave or has other qualities that some people think are typically male

examples.text: Come on, now—be a man.
She's more of a man than he is.

definitions.definition: a group or person that is thought to be in authority or control, especially the police or white people in government

examples.text: Activists marched to the police station to voice their displeasure with the Man.

definitions.definition: a male servant

examples.text: My man will drive you home.

definitions.definition: one of the figures or objects that you play with in a game such as chess
with everyone doing or thinking the same thing at the same time; in agreement

examples.text: The crowd rose to their feet as one man.
The staff speak as one man on this issue.

definitions.definition: to please everyone by changing your attitudes or opinions to suit different people
to be understood or used in different ways by different people
to be the best or most suitable person to do a particular job, etc.

examples.text: For a superb haircut, David's your man.

definitions.definition: to be strong or brave enough

examples.text: He was not man enough to face up to his responsibility.

definitions.definition: to act or think independently, not following others or being ordered

examples.text: Working for himself meant that he could be his own man.

definitions.definition: people must take care of themselves and not give or expect any help

examples.text: In business, it's every man for himself.

definitions.definition: a man who is respected in a particular profession that he has been involved in for a long time

examples.text: James Lovelock, the grand old man of environmental science

definitions.definition: with a lot of force or energy

examples.text: He flew out of the room like a man possessed.

definitions.definition: to make a young man develop and become more adult

examples.text: They thought the army would make a man of him.

definitions.definition: a man who frequently goes to fashionable parties, clubs, theatres, etc.

examples.text: In his new suit, he looked quite the man about town.

definitions.definition: a man/woman who likes the same things or has the same opinions as you
from when somebody was young to when they were old or older

examples.text: He's been doing the same job for 50 years—man and boy.

definitions.definition: an average or ordinary person, either male or female

examples.text: Politicians often don't understand the views of the man in the street.
What really matters to the man and woman in the street?

definitions.definition: a religious man, especially a priest or a clergyman
a man who is chosen as having given the best performance in a game of football (soccer), cricket, etc.

examples.text: Stokes was named man of the match.

definitions.definition: the man who is the best at a particular point in time

examples.text: Man of the moment Tom Ford greets the crowd at the end of his show.

definitions.definition: a person with many skills
a man/woman who understands and supports ordinary people

examples.text: He is not only a statesman, but also a man of the people.

definitions.definition: a rich and powerful man or woman
a person with a lot of experience of life, who is not easily surprised or shocked
a way of describing a dog
a person’s home is a place where they can be private and safe and do as they like
a man who is more popular with men than with women
between two men who are treating each other honestly and equally

examples.text: I'm telling you all this man to man.
a man-to-man talk

definitions.definition: a person who is in danger because their enemies want to harm them

examples.text: He has been a marked man since he decided to cooperate with the police.

definitions.definition: the average person

examples.text: I can enjoy a joke **as well as the next man**, but this is going too far.

definitions.definition: a person or thing that is different from others or does not fit easily into a group or set

examples.text: At school he was always the odd man out.
Dog, cat, horse, shoe—which is the odd one out?

definitions.definition: used to say that different people like different things; what one person likes very much, another person does not like at all
a person or thing that is similar to but of a lower quality than a particular famous person or thing

examples.text: Sparkling white wine is the poor man's champagne.

definitions.definition: to show or prove who is brave, skilful, etc. and who is not
used to emphasize that something is true of all the people being described

examples.text: They answered ‘Yes,’ to a man.
They were all destroyed, to the last man.

definitions.definition: a person who is determined or wants something very much will succeed

wordOrigin: Old English man(n), (plural) menn (noun), mannian (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch man, German Mann, and Sanskrit manu ‘mankind’.
